title: How a Top Secret SEAL Team 6 Mission Into North Korea Fell Apart
summary: The 2019 operation, greenlit by President Trump, sought a strategic edge. It left unarmed North Koreans dead.

title: Labor Market Stalled This Summer, With August Data Adding to Slowdown
summary: Employers added 22,000 jobs in August. Revised data also showed that employment fell by 13,000 jobs in June, the first net loss since December 2020.

title: Weak Jobs Report Strengthens Case for Fed to Cut Interest Rates
summary: A reduction at the Federal Reserve’s next meeting this month looks all but assured after August’s labor market data.

title: U.S. Oil Giant ConocoPhillips Will Lay Off Up to 25% of Its Work Force
summary: ConocoPhillips of Houston on Wednesday announced plans to reduce its global work force by up to 25 percent.

title: South Koreans Swept Up in Immigration Raid at Hyundai E.V. Plant in Georgia
summary: They were among nearly 500 workers apprehended at a construction site for a South Korean battery maker, officials said. The episode prompted diplomatic concern in Seoul.

title: Mounting Deportations Meet Slow Hiring in a ‘Curious Kind of Balance’
summary: An influx of immigrants helped ease worker shortages, and now their expulsion is helping to mask the country’s weakening demand for labor.

title: The Doctors Are Real, but the Sales Pitches Are Frauds
summary: Scammers are using A.I. tools to make it look as if medical professionals are promoting dubious health care products.

title: AI Influencers Like Lil’ Miquela and Mia Zelu Are Redefining Fame
summary: Influencers like Lil’ Miquela and Mia Zelu have millions of followers and generate serious income, despite being created with artificial intelligence.

title: Talks Between Adams and Trump Adviser Center on Saudi Ambassadorship
summary: The discussions are said to be part of an effort to get Mayor Eric Adams to end his mayoral campaign in New York City, clearing a path for Andrew Cuomo.

title: The N.Y. Assembly’s Most Powerful Democrat Has Been Slow to Back Mamdani
summary: Carl Heastie, the speaker of the Assembly, has not yet endorsed his fellow lawmaker. He’s not the only prominent Democrat to hold back support.

title: Keanu Reeves and Alex Winter Are Ready for ‘Godot’
summary: After years of training (clowning, Butoh and more), the longtime friends take on Samuel Beckett’s towering drama on Broadway.

title: Elon Musk Could Become First Trillionaire Under New Tesla Pay Package
summary: Tesla’s board unveiled a compensation package for the chief executive that could be worth $900 billion if he meets ambitious targets.

title: Israel Steps Up Attacks on Gaza City Ahead of a Planned Wider Offensive
summary: The Israeli military destroyed a landmark building after saying it had taken control of almost half of the city, where hundreds of thousands of civilians are sheltering amid a worsening humanitarian crisis.

title: Why Hamas Refuses to Give Up Fighting
summary: Analysts say that despite its vast losses in Gaza, Hamas believes it can hold out for a deal that ensures its survival.

title: CBS Abruptly Changes Rules for Editing ‘Face the Nation’ Interviews
summary: The change came less than a week after an interview aired with Kristi Noem, the homeland security secretary. The administration accused the network of deceptively editing her appearance.

title: ‘Something Is Wrong With My Brain’: A Police Officer’s Descent
summary: Brent Simpson is the first police officer known to have C.T.E. He showed signs of the disease in the last few years of his life.

title: The Trump Administration Wants to Switch Off Climate Satellites
summary: The Trump administration wants to switch off and possibly destroy the climate-monitoring technology.

title: YouTube’s NFL Broadcast Will Test Platform’s Ability to Handle Live Sports
summary: YouTube’s live broadcast on Friday night of the Kansas City Chiefs and Los Angeles Chargers game is set to be a major test of the platform’s programming ambitions.

title: Chicago Could Be a Powder Keg
summary: Many residents are willing to endorse or participate in violent resistance.

title: Why I Am Not a Liberal
summary: I don’t think the left grasps reality in all its fullness.

title: A Nighttime Raid
summary: An investigation details a previously undisclosed U.S. operation to intercept the North Korean leader’s communications.

title: Google Is Fined $3.5 Billion for Breaking Europe’s Antitrust Laws
summary: European Union officials accused the American tech giant of using its size and dominance to undercut rivals in online advertising, a move that could raise the ire of the Trump administration.

title: Duchess of Kent, Royal Who Comforted a Wimbledon Loser, Dies at 92
summary: A member of an aristocratic family, she married the Duke of Kent, a cousin of Queen Elizabeth II.

title: Questions Focus on Cable in Lisbon Funicular Crash
summary: Images of recovery efforts in the accident, which killed 16 people on Wednesday, appeared to show damage to a cable connecting the funicular’s two cars.

title: Kim Jong-un Leaves Beijing With Big Diplomatic Wins
summary: Mr. Kim’s presence at a Chinese military parade was a sign of his growing geopolitical ​leverage and that North Korea was being accepted as a de facto nuclear power.
